page.title: 01North of Slaley
page.content: This rural area slopes from 190 metres in West to the March Burn in East and its confluence with Dipton Burn at Dipton Foot in North EAst. March Burn is deeply incised, its banks covered with mixed wood. Old Drove Road from Dipton Foot fords March Burn, a small footbridge alongside, become a sunken way, steep banks covered in brambles, sapplings, brambles, thorn, oak, ash, hazel. Signs of badgers, fox, rabbit, red squirrels. Minor West-East road across the centre gives views of coniferous forest to north on sandstone,and farming land, primarily pasture to south. Isolated farms lie off the rood to south, their access roads changing to footpaths, continue south to Slaley across fields. Haydon Hunt hunt the area.
